alert.note: Alert for Christian; Todd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 11:02PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Christian and Todd Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1001 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Cobb to 7 miles southwest of Hopkinsville to 6 miles west of Fort Campbell. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fort Campbell around 1010 PM CDT. Oak Grove around 1015 PM CDT. Hopkinsville around 1020 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pembroke, Guthrie and Elkton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 75 and 92. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
